title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, the system should confirm that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Currently, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder to a bin directory. However, this bin directory contains more than just .class files, which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new project for an existing directory structure.
2. Point the output folder to a bin directory.
3. Confirm that the system does not provide a warning or confirmation regarding the existing content in the bin directory.
4. Delete the output directory manually.
5. Rebuild the output directory.
6. Note that the system should provide a warning or confirmation before deleting the existing content in the bin directory.
